column4: problem is windows didnt overwrite grub might have something to do with how i installed it on a different hdd then ubuntu but i dont know
i cant understand what you mean

i installed windows to a third hard drive that i have ubuntu is on the second but after installing windows ubuntu is what booted. i am checking now to see if it is as simple as i forgot to make the windows partitinion a boot partition
no it has the boot flag
hmmm well either way i cant get windows to boot
ok that doesnt really tell me how to reinstall greub
tried that 2 rebootsd ago it didnt work
if you want to skip fscks do sudo touch /fastboot
and what does this command do?
it would create a file fastboot, grub generally looks for 2 files before fsck forcefsck and fastboot, fastboot would make it skip the fsck
and how do i undo the command?
the file gets automatically deleted after the boot, so if again you want to skip, you would have to redo that command
